HTMLElementAttributeStyleMap.summary: The attributeStyleMap read-only property of the interface returns a live object that contains a list of style properties of the element that are defined in the element's inline style attribute, or assigned using the property of the interface via script.

remarks.para: Shorthand properties are expanded. If you set border-top: 1px solid black, the longhand properties (border-top-color, border-top-style, and border-top-width) are set instead.
The main difference between property and attributeStyleMap property is that, the style property will return a object, while the attributeStyleMap property will return a object.
Though the property itself is not writable, you could read and write inline styles through the object that it returns, just like through the object that returns via the style property.
